titleStmt.title: Articles of peace & commerce between the most serene and mighty prince Charles II by the grace of God, King of Great Britain, France and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. and the most illustrious lords, the Bashaw, Dey, Aga and governours of the famous city and kingdom of Algiers in Barbary concluded by Arthur Herbert, esquire, Admiral of His Majesties fleet in the Mediterranean Seas, on the tenth day of April, old stile, 1682.
Treaties, etc. Algeria, 1682 Apr. 20
titleStmt.author: England and Wales.
Torrington, Arthur Herbert, Earl of, 1647-1716.
Algeria. Treaties, etc. England and Wales, 1682 Apr. 20.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assigns of John Bill deceas'd and by Henry Hills and Thomas Newcomb,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
